meanings.definition: The process in cell division in which the cytoplasm divides, resulting in two daughter cells.
meanings.sent1: During cytokinesis, the cell's cytoplasm splits to form new cells.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study cytokinesis to understand how cells multiply.
meanings.sent3: The cytoplasm threw a cytokinesis party, inviting all the organelles to divide and conquer!
meanings.sent4: In the dance of cell division, cytokinesis is the grand finale where the cytoplasm takes a bow.
meanings.sent5: Imagine cytokinesis as a magical show where the cytoplasm performs its ultimate disappearing act, creating new life.

meanings.definition: The final stage of cell division, following the separation of the genetic material.
meanings.sent1: After the DNA separates, cytokinesis completes the cell division process.
meanings.sent2: Cytokinesis marks the end of cell division, ensuring two new cells are formed.
meanings.sent3: The genetic material and the cytoplasm high-fived as cytokinesis wrapped up the cell division party.
meanings.sent4: As the cell division journey ends, cytokinesis is the last puzzle piece that brings two new cells to life.
meanings.sent5: The separation of genetic material is like a prelude to the grand finale of cytokinesis, where new cells emerge.
